title.narrative: PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE AGAINST SCHOOL-AGE CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS

description.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Education, the governing bodies of the justice system and other service providers possess the knowledge, strategies and tools to prevent violence against school-age children and adolescents, with a genderbased, intercultural approach and the capacity to respond to emergencies., which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents in Ecuador exercise their right to a life free from violence and exploitation, with a focus on early childhood and adolescence, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Education, the governing bodies of the justice system and other service providers possess the knowledge,strategies and tools to prevent violence against school-age children and adolescents, with a genderbased, intercultural approachand the capacity to respond to emergencies.

description.narrative: The CO continued to work on violence prevention at national and community level through the ‘Ahora Tú decides’ campaign developed with and for adolescents to prevent sexual violence. A unified protocol has been developed jointly with the protection programme to prevent cases of sexual violence. It produces training worksheets on the prevention of sexual violence among adolescents and trains teachers in peace education and violence prevention with children and adolescents. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of children and adolescents between 5 to 19 years old who take part of life skills programmes supported by UNICEF in prioritized territories. (67207)

baseline.value: 40,000 (this is the initial model that is the base for the design of a peace education strategy)

title.narrative: Ministry of Education has a new evidence based proposal for its life skills programme to prevent violence in educational communities(67208)

baseline.value: Current life skills initiative in schools nationwide not institutionalized

target.value: 2022:Piloting and systematization (including costing) of the implementation of the new life skills education programme in prioritized territories

actual.value: 2021:The context of the pandemic did not allow for this activity
